Social.job: Hook literature students with the Scout paradox - that she breaks every narration rule yet creates the most compelling reading experience.
must_do: Present the paradox as a puzzle ('Scout knows too much AND too little - how?')
Use specific examples that feel impossible (child Scout understanding Boo, adult Scout revealing too much)
Create urgency around solving this literary mystery
must_not_do: Reveal the Maturing Moral Witness pattern
Give away the solution - only agitate the problem
Social.thread_usage: Uses the agitation register to present Scout as a narrator who impossibly breaks rules - knows too much about adult themes while understanding too little about her world, creating intrigue about how this works
Social.success_metric: High engagement (likes, shares, saves) and click-through to YouTube video
Social.failure_mode: Explaining the solution instead of just presenting the paradox, or being too academic instead of intriguing

YouTube.job: Demonstrate the Maturing Moral Witness pattern by walking through 2-3 concrete Scout examples, showing how the dual consciousness creates the reading experience.
must_do: Show the pattern working with specific textual examples
Explain bidirectional unreliability with visual examples
Connect this to broader first-person retrospective narration
must_not_do: Rush through examples without showing the mechanism
Focus only on TKAM without showing the broader pattern
Give the complete analytical framework (save for guide)
YouTube.thread_usage: Demonstrates the solution register - shows how 'first-person retrospective narration filters adult moral understanding through remembered childhood innocence' works in practice with Scout's specific scenes
YouTube.success_metric: High watch time, comments asking for more examples, and guide download conversions
YouTube.failure_mode: Being too abstract without concrete textual proof, or giving away everything without maintaining guide value

SEO.job: Answer 'how does Scout's narration work' searches by explaining the dual consciousness mechanism that creates TKAM's unique reading experience.
must_do: Address specific search queries about Scout's narrative technique
Explain the child/adult consciousness split with examples
Position the guide as the complete analytical toolkit
must_not_do: Compete with YouTube content by using same examples
Focus on other characters or themes beyond Scout's narration
SEO.thread_usage: Uses solution register to answer search intent - explains how Scout's retrospective narration creates systematic unreliability through the tension between child comprehension and adult revelation
SEO.success_metric: High organic traffic from TKAM narration searches and guide conversion rate
SEO.failure_mode: Keyword stuffing without delivering genuine insight, or duplicating YouTube content instead of complementing it

Guide.job: Deliver the complete Maturing Moral Witness analytical framework with all devices, variations, and application methods for any first-person retrospective text.
must_do: Provide the full pattern taxonomy and recognition criteria
Include multiple text examples beyond just TKAM
must_not_do: Repeat social/YouTube content without adding depth
Focus only on TKAM instead of the broader pattern
Leave gaps in the analytical framework
Guide.thread_usage: Fully unpacks the core dynamic: provides systematic framework for analyzing how retrospective narration creates bidirectional unreliability across texts, with Scout as the primary case study
Guide.success_metric: High completion rate, positive feedback on analytical depth, and application to other texts
Guide.failure_mode: Being too theoretical without practical application tools, or not delivering significantly more value than the free content
